00027 class Vector1
00028 {
00029 public:

00032         ~Vector1(void);
00033         Vector1 &operator=(const Vector1 &vector);
00034         Vector1 &zero(void);
00035 
00036         static int n_comps(void);
00037         static void range_check(int comp);
00038 
00039         double &operator()(int comp);
00040         double operator()(int comp) const;
00041         double &component(int comp);
00042         double component(int comp) const;
00043 
00044         Vector1 &operator*=(double s);
00045         Vector1 &operator+=(const Vector1 &b);
00046         Vector1 &operator-=(const Vector1 &b);
00047 
00048 private:
00049         double v1;
00050 
00051         Vector1(double v1_);
00052 
00053         friend inline Vector1 operator*(double s, const Vector1 &a);
00054         friend inline Vector1 operator+(const Vector1 &a, const Vector1 &b);
00055         friend inline Vector1 operator-(const Vector1 &a, const Vector1 &b);
00056         friend inline Vector1 operator*(const Matrix1 &matrix,
00057                 const Vector1 &vector);
00058         friend inline double operator*(const Vector1 &a, const Vector1 &b);
00059         friend inline istream &operator>>(istream &is, Vector1 &vector);
00060         friend inline ostream &operator<<(ostream &os, const Vector1 &vector);
00061         friend class Matrix1;   // for row() and column()
00062 };

00073 Vector1::n_comps(void)

00080 inline void
00081 Vector1::range_check(int comp)
00082 {
00083         if (comp < 0 || comp >= Vector1::n_comps())
00084                 THROW(RangeViolation1());
00085 }

00286 inline void
00287 Matrix1::range_check(int row, int col)
00288 {
00289         if (row < 0 || row >= Vector1::n_comps())
00290                 THROW(RangeViolation1());
00291         if (col < 0 || col >= Vector1::n_comps())
00292                 THROW(RangeViolation1());
00293 }
00294 
00295 #else /* ! Vector1_NO_CHECKING */

00298 Matrix1::range_check(int /* row */, int /* col */)
00299 {
00300 }
00301 
00302 #endif /* Vector1_NO_CHECKING */

00354 inline Vector1
00355 Matrix1::row(int i)

00357         Vector1::range_check(i);

00389 inline Matrix1 &
00390 Matrix1::equals_multiple_of_identity(double s)

00392         e11 = s;
00393         return *this;

00396 inline Matrix1 &
00397 Matrix1::add_multiple_of_identity(double s)

00399         e11 += s;
00400         return *this;

00402 
00403 inline void
00404 Matrix1::eigen(Vector1 &evals, Matrix1 &evects)
00405 {
00406         evals(0) = e11;
00407         evects(0,0) = 1.;
00408 }

00441 inverse(const Matrix1 &matrix)

00443         return Matrix1(1./matrix.e11);

00447 transpose(const Matrix1 &matrix)
00448 {
00449         return Matrix1(matrix);

00452 inline Matrix1
00453 deviator(const Matrix1 & /* matrix */)
00454 {
00455         Matrix1 M(0.);
00456         return M;
00457 }

00459 inline double
00460 trace(const Matrix1 &matrix)
00461 {
00462         return matrix.e11;
00463 }

00465 inline double
00466 matrix_one_norm(const Matrix1 &matrix)
00467 {
00468         double norm;
00469         norm = fabs(matrix.e11);
00470         return norm;
00471 }
00472 
00473 inline double
00474 matrix_infinity_norm(const Matrix1 &matrix)
00475 {
00476         double norm;
00477         norm = fabs(matrix.e11);
00478         return norm;
00479 }

00495 class FactorMatrix1
00496 {
00497 public:
00498         FactorMatrix1(void);
00499         ~FactorMatrix1(void);
00500         FactorMatrix1(const FactorMatrix1 &F);
00501         FactorMatrix1 &operator=(const FactorMatrix1 &F);
00502 
00503 private:
00504         Matrix1 inverse;        // Unlike FactorMatrixN, FactorMatrix1 holds
00505                                 // inverse matrix only.
00506 
00507         FactorMatrix1(const Matrix1 &matrix);   // Copies matrix.
00508                                                 // (It does not invert it.)
00509 
00510         friend FactorMatrix1 factor(const Matrix1 &matrix);
00511         friend Vector1 solve(const FactorMatrix1 &F, const Vector1 &vector);
00512         friend Matrix1 solve(const FactorMatrix1 &F, const Matrix1 &matrix);
00513         friend inline ostream &operator<<(ostream &os, const FactorMatrix1 &F);
00514 };
00515 
00516 FactorMatrix1 factor(const Matrix1 &matrix);
00517 Vector1 solve(const FactorMatrix1 &F, const Vector1 &vector);
00518 Matrix1 solve(const FactorMatrix1 &F, const Matrix1 &matrix);

00520 inline ostream &operator<<(ostream &os, const FactorMatrix1 &F);

00523 FactorMatrix1::FactorMatrix1(void)
00524         : inverse()
00525 {
00526 }
00527 
00528 inline
00529 FactorMatrix1::~FactorMatrix1(void)
00530 {
00531 }
00532 
00533 inline
00534 FactorMatrix1::FactorMatrix1(const FactorMatrix1 &F)
00535         : inverse(F.inverse)
00536 {
00537 }
00538 
00539 inline FactorMatrix1 &
00540 FactorMatrix1::operator=(const FactorMatrix1 &F)
00541 {
00542         inverse = F.inverse;
00543         return *this;
00544 }
00545 
00546 inline
00547 FactorMatrix1::FactorMatrix1(const Matrix1 &matrix)
00548         : inverse(matrix)
00549 {
00550 }
00551 
00552 inline FactorMatrix1
00553 factor(const Matrix1 &matrix)
00554 {
00555         return FactorMatrix1(::inverse(matrix));
00556 }
00557 
00558 inline Vector1
00559 solve(const FactorMatrix1 &F, const Vector1 &vector)
00560 {
00561         return F.inverse * vector;
00562 }
00563 
00564 inline Matrix1
00565 solve(const FactorMatrix1 &F, const Matrix1 &matrix)
00566 {
00567         return F.inverse * matrix;
00568 }
00569 
00570 inline ostream &
00571 operator<<(ostream &os, const FactorMatrix1 &F)
00572 {
00573         os << F.inverse;
00574         return os;
00575 }
